message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using World Bank Enterprise Survey data and micro-geographic maps of firm locations, we investigate the effect of transport infrastructure on export participation in Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Survey", "micro-geographic maps"], "topic": ["Trade", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "This study examines the impact of digital innovation on financial inclusion using data from the Global Findex database between 2011 and 2017.", "dataset": ["Global Findex"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Digital Development"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze a unique dataset of electricity consumption and household expenditures collected through mobile phone-based surveys from more than 3,900 Rwandan households in 2015-16.", "dataset": ["mobile phone-based surveys"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "This paper employs a novel sampling strategy to combine two datasets - the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA) and the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) - to examine the linkages between subsistence agriculture and child nutrition outcomes in Tanzania.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)", "Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "We use firm-level data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys as well as geospatial data on roads, railways and ports to investigate the effect of transport infrastructure on firms' export decisions and productivity gains in Bangladesh.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Trade", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We use rainfall data from CHIRPS and nightlights data from VIIRS to construct a daily district-level panel dataset of precipitation and economic activity in sub-Saharan Africa from 2000 to 2018.", "dataset": ["CHIRPS", "VIIRS"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Economic Growth"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses administrative fiscal data over the years 2000-2015 to evaluate the redistributive effects of Argentina’s tax and transfer system at a national and regional level.", "dataset": ["administrative fiscal data"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using the World Development Indicators dataset, we examine the relationship between economic growth and social sustainability in low- and lower-middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics", "Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We merge the Global Multidimensional Poverty Index with household microdata to analyze poverty dynamics and mobility in Nigeria, Kenya, and Cameroon.", "dataset": ["Global Multidimensional Poverty Index", "household microdata"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This paper explores the relationship between public-private partnerships and infrastructure investment using cross-country data from the Private Participation in Infrastructure (PPI) database and country-level governance indicators from the Worldwide Governance Indicators (WGI) project.", "dataset": ["Private Participation in Infrastructure (PPI)", "Worldwide Governance Indicators (WGI)"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Doing Business report, this study examines the relationship between regulatory quality and firm performance in the Middle East and North Africa region.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Doing Business report"], "topic": ["Governance", "Competitiveness"]}]
